segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshuranmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine

In this session we will be discussing from the 21st verse.
Of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The meaning of this verse is are you feeling compunction for the unhappy women and children
who are left forlorn by unscrupulous persons or are you unhappy because the goddess of
learning is being handled by brahmanas addicted to acts against the principles of religion
or are you sorry to see that the brahmanas have taken shelter of administrative powers
their families but do not respect brahmanical culture.
So this verse is a continuation of dharma questioning mother earth . Dharma in the shape
of a bull is asking mother earth in the shape of a cow.
Three more questions are raised here . All these are symptoms of suffering of the people
in culture.
Now if we know about practice of practice of practice of practice of practice of practice
Kali Yuga. Mother earth is feeling for the people of this earth planet who are suffering
in this Kali Yuga in different ways. So, dharma is questioning mother earth.
Are you feeling compunction? What is the meaning of compunction? Compunction means
are you feeling sad or sorry for the unhappy women and children
who are left forlorn. Forlorn means they are completely deserted. They are
left alone to suffer on their own by unscrupulous persons.
Prabhupada will explain how this is happening in the purport, but I am just going through the
verse itself. This is the first question. Then the next question being asked by dharma in the
same verse, in these 21st verses. Or are you unhappy because the goddess of learning is being
handled by brahmanas addicted to acts against the principles of religion? That means knowledge is
in the hands of brahmanas. They learn and they disseminate that knowledge to the people in
society. Now, these brahmanas, if they don't have the knowledge, they don't have the knowledge to
follow the principles of religion, the dharmic principles, then they become disqualified as
brahmanas. Then they are no longer able to properly either learn or properly disseminate
or set a right example or teach people the right values, right principles. They are unable to do
that. So, this is another sorry state of affairs in this Kali Yuga.
We don't have qualified brahmanas. We have teachers, but they are not qualified brahmanas.
They don't follow principles. Then the third question is, or are you sorry to see that the
brahmanas have taken shelter of administrative families that do not respect brahmanical culture?
These brahmanas, then knowledgeable or learned people, they work for the government.
And they are not treated properly by the government. They are forced to commit sinful activities
in spite of having knowledge because they are dependent for their livelihood upon the government's salary.
So, they cannot say, I won't do something that they are asked to do. So, they will do it.
Even though they know it's wrong, it is bad, it is sinful, it is going to bring about,
lot of misery, suffering for the people. Still, they cannot avoid, they cannot refuse,
they cannot instruct the administrators that this is not correct, what you are doing.
They cannot do that. So, this is a sorry plight of the people in this Kali Yuga due to the
degradation or the bad, evil influence of Kali. So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada says,
in the age of Kali,
the women and the children along with brahmanas and cows will be grossly neglected and left unprotected.
This is Kali Yuga symptom.
In the scriptures it is said very clearly, in a civilized society five categories of people
deserve to be protected by the government and by the respective, respective guardians, respective leaders.
or respective protectors the women had to be protected by men especially in the
young age by the father a girl has to be protected in the middle age by her
husband and in old age by her son or another guardian family guardian so this
is the protection that shastras say must be given to women what happens if they
are not given protection then they are exploited by unscrupulous ruffians rogues
and and uncultured mlechas yavanas gundas drunkards meat-eaters womanizers
woman hunters prostitute hunters

So many women, because somehow they get married or even if they are not married, they have their living partner. Then they have a child and the person who is supposed to be the father of the child that is born, he just walks out due to divorce or separation or broken family.

Relationship, whatever, broken marriage. And then the child and the mother are left unprotected, uncared for. That's what is being mentioned here. And the numbers are increasing as the years go by. Numbers are increasing.
And one more problem in this Kaliwai's present age is circumstantial. The women will try to become into the relationship.

Independent of the protection of marriage. Sorry, independent protection of men through marriage. They want to be independent. This independent is dangerous for the woman. Why? Because then she is prone to be exploited by rogues, ruffians.
As long as they are married and there is a proper family unit.
Where they are married.
They are given proper protection. They are guided and they are cared for. Women will be exploited.
They will be exploited. That's what we see everywhere around us now.
The brahmanas, they are traditionally intelligent people who can pick up knowledge, who can learn, who can teach.
But in Kali Yuga,
they will acquire modern education, but as far as moral and religious principles are concerned, they don't care for that.
They shall be most fallen in terms of following good moral principles.
Very intelligent, very educated, very learned, but as far as morality is concerned, very, very poor, very bad.
So, education,
education and bad character don't go together, normally, but in Kali Yuga, they will run parallel.

The person is very intelligent, very educated, very learned, but as for don't ask what is his character, character is worst character, because they don't care to follow the principles, moral principles, religious principles, they don't care to follow.
And,
what about the administrators?
They call themselves a secular.
Because of it, they don't follow any of the eternal Vedic principles.
So, they say we don't believe.
And, they have their own so-called system of administration.
They don't follow the standard authorities, Manusamhita, etc.
So, they have some concocted system of governance.

And, they will actually not give protection to the genuine brahmanas, to followers of real dharma, because of which, there will be so much of degradation in society, because people don't get proper guidance from a qualified brahmana, they become degraded.
The innocent people, the common people become degraded.
And, society will actually become very, very, very, very fallen.
So, that is what is being described here.
So, these are some of the symptoms of the age of Kali, which are harmful to the general welfare of the human society.
That's why this is being raised here.
Dharma, personified in the form of a bull.
To Mother Earth, personified in the form of a cow.

So, this conversation is going to lead to some real enlightenment in understanding what is the necessity of dharma, what is the necessity of following the Vedic principles, absolute necessity for the well-being of the entire society.
So, I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
